titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts
Scheuer (Steven H.) Collection of Television Program Scripts
titlestmt.author: by Jay Mead

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:55
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

did.unittitle: Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts contains approximately five thousand American television scripts dating from about 1953 to 1963. The scripts offer insight into programming during the period in which television became a fixture in the average home and the primary medium for news and entertainment. The collection contains a wide range of program genres, including variety shows, drama serials, historical drama, crime drama and reenactments, plays, situation comedies, westerns, documentaries, interviews, music, and religious programs. All three major broadcast networks in the United States during this time period--ABC, CBS, and NBC--are represented. The collection also contains a small number of press releases and some material documenting the activities of TV Key, including draft reports and synopses.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was created originally on a typewriter. It was converted to an electronic file by means of scanning and Optical Character Recognition software, and encoded in EAD. A number of format changes were necessary to present the structure of this finding aid in accordance with current practice.

bioghist.head: Steven H. Scheuer (1926-)
bioghist.p: Steven H. Scheuer is a television and film critic. His syndicated preview column "TV Key" ran in newspapers throughout the United States beginning in 1953, and he edited the related annual publication TV Key Movie Guide , later Movies on TV .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Steven H. Scheuer Collection of Television Program Scripts contains approximately five thousand American television scripts dating from about 1953 to 1963. The scripts offer insight into programming during the period in which television became a fixture in the average home and the primary medium for news and entertainment. The collection contains a wide range of program genres, including variety shows, drama serials, historical drama, crime drama and reenactments, plays, situation comedies, westerns, documentaries, interviews, music, and religious programs. All three major broadcast networks in the United States during this time period--ABC, CBS, and NBC--are represented. The collection also contains a small number of press releases and some material documenting the activities of TV Key, including draft reports and synopses.
An index of authors, subjects, and interview subjects can be found in Appendices I-III, at the end of the finding aid.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically by program title. Following the main alphabetic sequence, under the heading "Specials," are scripts and fragments not identifiable as part of a program series. One box of TV Key press releases is filed at the end of the collection. Folders numbers begin again with number 1 in each box.

odd.head: Appendix I: Alphabetical Index of Authors
odd.p: Author listings are followed by box and folder numbers and name of program. For example: "Abbott, George 318:4 Pond's Theatre" is a reference to a script by George Abbott stored in box 318, folder 4, filed with other scripts in the "Pond's Theatre" series.
Names of programs are not repeated for subsequent entries under the same author.

Likewise, "Allen, Ethan 1:7 Accent" refers to a script concerning Ethan Allen stored in box 1, folder 7, filed with other scripts in the series titled "Accent".

odd.head: General note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p:
The following shows do not appear to be a part of any series. (It is possible that some of the shows are indeed parts of series, but lack any identifying information on the title page.) They are divided into four categories:
(1) Entertainment. These shows are primarily music and variety.
(2) Drama. These are TV Dramas of all sorts.
(3) Documentary. Any informative and educational shows fall into this category: documentaries, current events, news analysis, etc.
(4) Interviews. These are a number of transcripts of interviews with politicians, entertainers, world leaders, and others.
